Namespaces

  • namespace ArrayTool

Template functions for dynamic allocation of arrays.

Example usage 1:

uint32 allocSize = 10; uint32 size = 0; byte* buf = new buff[allocSize];

buff = ArrayTool::addElement(buf, 7, size, allocSize); ... // Reallocs to actual size. buff = Utility::realloc(buf, size, size, allocSize);

// Finished with adding elements. Store buffer and // buffer size. m_importantBuffer = buf; m_importantSize = size;

Example usage 2:

Old member variables in class: Vector m_numbers;

Old method, called seldomly in running system: void addNumber(uint32 number) { m_numbers.addLast(number); }

New member variables in class: uint32 m_nbrNumbers; uint16* m_numbers;

New member function: void addNumber(uint32 number) { m_numbers = ArrayTool::addElement(m_numbers, number, m_nbrNumbers); }

  • template<class T, class S> T * reallocate (T *buf, uint32 nbrElems, uint32 newAllocSize, S &allocSize)
    Reallocates array.

Function Documentation

template<class T, class S>
T* addElement (  T *  buf,
const T &  elem,
S &  nbrElems
) 
 

Add element last to array.

Assumed that allocSize of the array is equal to the number of elements. Always reallocates the buffer to nbrElems + 1.

Parameters:
buf The array to add the element to.
elem The element to add.
nbrElements The allocated size and the number of valid elements in buf.
Returns:
A new array with the old elements in it. Plus the new one.

template<class T, class S>
T* addElement (  T *  buf,
const T &  elem,
S &  nbrElems,
S &  allocSize
) 
 

Add element last to array.

Parameters:
buf The array to add element to.
elem The element to add.
nbrElems The number of valid elements in buf. Will be increased by one.
allocSize The number of allocated elements in buf. Can change if the array must be reallocated.
Returns:
The array or a new one that has been reallocated.

template<class T, class S>
T* reallocate (  T *  buf,
uint32  nbrElems,
uint32  newAllocSize,
S &  allocSize
) 
 

Reallocates array.

If the array will be shrunk, the destructor for the removed elements will be called.

Parameters:
buf The array to reallocate.
nbrElements The number of valid elements in the buf.
newAllocSize The new wanted allocation size.
allocSize The old allocationsize. Will be changed to newAllocSize.
Returns:
The new buffer.
